Cerence ASR JSON configuration reference

This ASR JSON configuration reference lists all possible JSON keys that can be used in the ASR configuration files.

How to read the tree structure below

This reference covers the JSON content that is typically put in the following files:

  • application.json

    Applications

  • dcc.json

    Dynamic Content Consumers.

  • asr_paths.json

    Basic ASR configuration: the base paths from where to load different types of files.

  • recognizer.json

    Recognizer setup information (Recognizers).

  • asr_manager.json

    ASR manager setup information (see Manager components for an explanation of the different manager components, and Minimal configuration for JSON configuration examples).

The JSON configuration can all be put in one file, or spread over several files. Each file must include a version key that specifies the ASR version for which the configuration is intended. The value should be set to "VoConHigh 5.0". Keys comment and label are optional. (Note that the configuration items listed below do not include logging and audio configuration.)

The following conventions apply when looking through the table below:

  • {  }

    Curly braces indicate nested JSON blocks. The link enclosed in the braces links to a section further down on the page where the keys are listed with their type, whether they are required or not, and a brief description. For example, ITopLevelAsrConfig links to a table describing

  • [  ]

    Square brackets, surrounding a type such as String, denote a JSON array. For example, the key acmod in the asr_paths block has a type of [ String ]. This means that its value is an array of strings:

    "acmod" : [ "../data/models_v1/", "../data/models_v2/" ],

  • If a JSON array contains only one element, the brackets can be omitted:

    "acmod" : [ "../data/models/acmod/" ]

    is equivalent to:

    "acmod" : "../data/models/acmod/"

  • For keys that have sub-keys, the sub-keys should be put inside a { } block. Example:

    "asr_paths" : {
  "acmod" : ... ,
  "asr" : ... ,
  ...
}

The following section details the JSON configuration format that is supported by Cerence ASR.

Overview

The following is an overview of the structure of the JSON configuration files.

  • { ITopLevelAsr5Config }
    • comment: String
    • version: String
    • label: String
    • asr_paths: { IAsrPathsConfig }
      • acmod: [ String ]
      • asr: [ String ]
      • liquid: [ String ]
      • search: [ String ]
      • search_cache: [ String ]
      • clc: [ String ]
      • dictionary: [ String ]
      • sem3: [ String ]
      • lex_cache: [ String ]
      • clc_cache: [ String ]
      • clc_ruleset: [ String ]
      • language_model: [ String ]
      • audio_based_classifier_model: [ String ]
    • dynamic_content_consumer: [ { IDynamicContentConsumerConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • progress_increment: int
      • limit_g2p_logging_errors: int
      • thread_priority: String
      • content: [ { IContentConfig } ]
        • name: String
        • type: ContentConfigType
      • type: String
      • bag_of_words: { IDynamicContentConsumerBagOfWordsConfig }
        • lexicon: { ILexiconConfig }
        • search: { IBagOfWordsDynamicContentConsumerContextConfig }
          • name: String
          • acmod: String
          • vocon_parameters: { IVPDynamicContentConsumerContextConfig }
            • LH_GRMCPL_PARAM_MAX_PARENTHESES_DEPTH: int
            • LH_GRMCPL_PARAM_WORDSCORE_SCALING: int
      • list: { IListContextDynamicContentConsumerConfig }
        • lexicon: { ILexiconConfig }
        • search: [ { IDynamicContentConsumerContextConfig } ]
          • name: String
          • acmod: String
          • tag_name: String
          • link: [ [ { ILinkConfig } ] ]
            • type: String
            • content: { IEntryLinkConfig }
              • name: String
              • clc_category: String
              • add_tag: bool
              • tag_name: String
            • filler: { IFillerLinkConfig }
              • clc_category: String
              • optional: bool
              • value: [ String ]
          • vocon_parameters: { IVPDynamicContentConsumerContextConfig }
        • persist_search: bool
      • remote: { IRemoteDynamicContentConsumerConfig }
        • connection_info: { IConnectionInfoConfig }
          • name: String
          • timeout: int
          • json: { IUserJsonConfig }
        • cloud_services_name: String
        • structured_content: { IStructuredContentConfig }
          • category: String
          • id: String
          • content: [ { IStructuredContentKeyConfig } ]
            • name: String
            • link: [ { IStructuredContentLinkConfig } ]
              • name: String
        • command: String
        • mode: String
        • grammar_type: String
        • data_chunk_size: int
        • data_total_size: int
        • timeout: int
        • force_clear_all: bool
      • slm_fm: { ISlmFmDynamicContentConsumerConfig }
        • lexicon: { ILexiconConfig }
        • slm_search: [ { IDynamicSlmContextConfig } ]
          • name: String
          • acmod: String
          • link: [ { ILinkConfig } ]
          • vocon_parameters: { IVPDynamicSlmContextConfig }
            • LH_SLMTRAINER_PARAM_NGRAM_ORDER: int
            • LH_SLMTRAINER_PARAM_SENTENCE_RESTART: String
        • fm_search: [ { IDynamicFuzzyMatchContextConfig } ]
          • filename: String
          • name: String
          • acmod: String
          • column: [ { IDynamicFuzzyMatchColumnConfig } ]
            • name: String
            • link: [ { IDynamicFuzzyMatchColumnLinkConfig } ]
              • name: String
            • type: String
            • integer: { IDynamicFuzzyMatchColumnIntegerConfig }
              • accumulate_result: bool
              • array: bool
              • activatable: bool
              • unique_values: bool
            • string: { IDynamicFuzzyMatchColumnStringConfig }
              • speakable: { IDynamicFuzzyMatchSpeakableConfig }
                • clc_category: String
                • activatable: bool
                • accumulate_result: bool
                • array: bool
                • split: bool
              • activatable: bool
              • accumulate_result: bool
              • array: bool
          • vocon_parameters: { IVPDynamicFuzzyMatchContextConfig }
            • LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_EXPECTED_NBR_DOMAINS: int
            • LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_CHECK_UNIQUENESS: String
            • LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_IS_COMPRESSED: String
            • LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_ONDEMAND_LEVEL: int
            • LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_ADVANCED_RESULT_SEPARATION: String
      • wuw: { IWUWDynamicContentConsumerConfig }
        • lexicon: { ILexiconConfig }
        • search: { IDynamicContentConsumerContextConfig }
        • id: String
    • recognizer: [ { IRecognizerConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • asr_engine: { IAsrEngineConfig }
        • name: String
        • language: [ { ILanguageConfig } ]
          • name: String
          • acmod: { IAcModConfig }
            • name: String
            • file_name: String
            • file_path: String
          • audio_based_classifier_model: { IAudioBasedClassifierConfig }
            • file_name: String
            • file_path: String
          • vocon_parameters: { IVPLanguageConfig }
        • vocon_parameters: { IVPEngineConfig }
          • LH_ENGINE_PARAM_SPEECHDETECTOR_ABSOLUTE_THRESHOLD: int
          • LH_ENGINE_PARAM_SPEECHDETECTOR_SENSITIVITY: int
          • LH_ENGINE_PARAM_AUDIOBUFFERSIZE_LEVEL1: int
          • LH_ENGINE_PARAM_AUDIOBUFFERSIZE_LEVEL2: int
        • speech_event: { ISpeechEventConfig }
          • show_nth_event: int
      • nds_audio_source: { INdsAudioSourceConfig }
        • ring_buffer_max_size: int
      • trailing_silence_threshold: int
      • audio_input: { IAudioInputConfig }
        • name: String
        • vocon_parameters: { IVPAudioInputConfig }
          • LH_AUDIOINPUT_PARAM_ENVIRONMENT_RESET: String
    • asr_manager: [ { IAsrManagerConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • liquid_config_file_name: String
      • plugin: { IPluginConfig }
        • content_values_iterator: [ { IContentValuesIteratorConfig } ]
          • name: String
          • config: { IUserJsonConfig }
        • post_processor: [ { IPostProcessorPluginConfig } ]
          • name: String
        • external: [ { IExternalResultProviderPluginConfig } ]
          • name: String
          • config: { IUserJsonConfig }
      • thread_pool: { IThreadPoolConfig }
        • dcc_creation: { IDCCCreationConfig }
          • max_number: int
          • name: String
        • dcc_data_preparation: { IDCCDataPreparationConfig }
          • low_priority: { ILowPriorityConfig }
            • max_number: int
            • name: String
          • normal_priority: { INormalPriorityConfig }
            • max_number: int
            • name: String
      • audio_source: { IAsrAudioSourceConfig }
        • nds_audio_source: { INdsAudioSourceConfig }
      • asr_data_file_name: String
    • application: [ { IApplicationConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • input: [ { IBaseInputConfig } ]
      • output: [ { IBaseOutputConfig } ]
        • name: String
        • type: String
        • internal_audio: { IInternalAudioOutputConfig }
          • json: { IUserJsonConfig }
      • nlu: [ { IBaseNluConfig } ]
      • post_processor: [ { IPostProcessorConfig } ]
        • name: String
        • source: [ String ]
        • library_name: String
        • config: { IUserJsonConfig }
    • input: [ { IBaseInputConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • type: String
      • asr: { IAsrInputConfig }
        • dccs_to_wait_for: [ { IDccToWaitForConfig } ]
          • name: String
          • source: String
        • search: [ { IBaseSearchConfig } ]
          • name: String
          • connection: [ { IBaseConnectionConfig } ]
            • expansion_point: String
            • search: { IBaseSearchConfig }
          • search_filter: { ISearchFilterConfig }
          • language_model: [ { ILanguageModelConfig } ]
            • name: String
            • type: String
            • static: { IStaticLanguageModelConfig }
              • file_name: String
              • file_path: String
          • vocon_parameters: { IVPSearchConfig }
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_STREAM_RESULT_MODE: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_ACCURACY: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_MAXNBEST: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TSILENCE: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_IG_LOWCONF: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_IG_HIGHCONF: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_INITBEAMWIDTH: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TANYSPEECH: String
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_NBESTRESULT_SETHIDDENKEYS: String
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_ONDEMANDLOADING: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_ONDEMANDLOADING_IDMAP: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_LMFACTOR: int
            • LH_SEARCH_PARAM_WORDSCORE_MODE: int
          • consolidated_update: { IConsolidatedUpdateConfig }
            • file_name: String
            • file_path: String
          • type: String
          • dynamic: { IDynamicSearchConfig }
            • dynamic_content_consumer: String
            • search_name: String
            • source: [ String ]
          • static: { IStaticSearchConfig }
            • file_name: String
            • file_path: String
            • do_crc_check: bool
      • cloud: { ICloudInputConfig }
        • cloud_services_name: String
        • query: { IQueryConfig }
          • name: String
          • command: String
          • connection_info: { IConnectionInfoConfig }
          • param: { IQueryParamConfig }
            • type: String
            • REQUEST_INFO: { IRequestInfoConfig }
              • json: { IUserJsonConfig }
          • trailing_silence_threshold: int
      • external: { IExternalInputConfig }
        • library_name: String
        • trailing_silence_threshold: int
        • config: { IUserJsonConfig }
        • output_audio_format: { IERPAudioFormatConfig }
          • name: String
          • sample_rate: int
          • samples_per_channel: int
          • channel_count: int
          • encoding: Encoding
          • container: Container
    • nlu: [ { IBaseNluConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • type: String
      • sem3: { ISem3NluConfig }
        • dccs_to_wait_for: [ { IDccToWaitForConfig } ]
        • app: [ { ISem3AppConfig } ]
          • name: String
          • file_name: String
          • file_path: String
          • additional_data: [ { ISem3AdditionalDataConfig } ]
        • filter: { ISem3FilterConfig }
    • search_filter: [ { ISearchFilterConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • type: String
      • field: { IFieldSearchFilterConfig }
        • actions: [ { IFieldSearchFilterActionConfig } ]
          • type: String
          • activate: { IActivateFieldSearchFilterActionConfig }
            • start: String
            • activate_from: String
            • user_ids: [ LH_S64 ]
          • add_start: { IAddStartFieldSearchFilterActionConfig }
            • start: String
            • mode: String
          • set_start_stop: { ISetStartStopFieldSearchFilterActionConfig }
            • start: String
            • stop: String
            • mode: String
      • rule_based: { IRuleBasedSearchFilterConfig }
        • mode: String
        • exception_rules: [ String ]
      • weight_based: { IWeightBasedSearchFilterConfig }
        • weights: [ { IWeightConfig } ]
          • name: String
          • weight: int
    • additional_data: [ { ISem3AdditionalDataConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • path: String
      • configuration: { ISem3AdditionalDataConfigurationConfig }
      • data: [ { ISem3DataConfig } ]
        • type: String
        • dynamic: { IDynamicSem3DataConfig }
          • dynamic_content_consumer: String
          • fm_search: String
          • source: [ String ]
        • static: { IStaticSem3DataConfig }
          • file_name: String
          • file_path: String
    • filter: [ { ISem3FilterConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • json: { IUserJsonConfig }
    • configuration: [ { ISem3AdditionalDataConfigurationConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • configuration_json_string: String
    • lexicon: [ { ILexiconConfig } ]
      • name: String
      • output_languages: { IOutputLanguagesConfig }
        • acmod: String
        • string: [ String ]
      • clc: { IClcConfig }
        • filename: String
        • vocon_parameters: { IVPClcConfig }
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_NUMBER_OUTPUT_TRANSCRIPTIONS: int
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_NO_RICH_TRANSCRIPTION: String
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_CLM_VARIANTS: String
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_NUMBER_PARTIAL_ORTH_VARIANTS: int
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_GENERATE_WORD_MARKERS: String
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_ML_EXTRA_MAINLANG_TRANSCRIPTIONS: String
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_ML_NR_PROMOTED_MAIN_TRANS: int
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_ML_POS_PROMOTED_MAIN_TRANS: int
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_IGNORE_SILENCES_FROM_DICTIONARY: String
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_DISABLE_MULTI_WORD_DICTIONARY_WITHOUT_ESC_SEQ_LOOKUP: String
          • LH_CLC_PARAM_CACHE_SIZE: int
        • clc_cache: String
        • dictionary: [ { IClcDictionaryConfig } ]
          • filename: String
          • lookup_strategy: LookupStrategy
        • ruleset: [ String ]
        • dict: [ { IClcBaseDictionaryConfig } ]
          • type: String
          • dynamic: { IClcDynamicDictionaryConfig }
            • dynamic_content_consumer: [ String ]
            • lookup_strategy: String
          • static: { IClcStaticDictionaryConfig }
            • filename: String
            • filepath: String
            • lookup_strategy: String
      • lex_cache: { ILexCacheConfig }
        • persist: bool
        • cache_word_size: int
      • text_normalizer: { ITextNormalizerConfig }
        • replace_with_whitespace: [ String ]

ITopLevelAsr5Config - The top-level configuration structure of the VoConHigh component.

The top-level configuration structure of the VoConHigh component.

This configuration class describes the top-level configuration structure in the VoConHigh namespace.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"comment": String no A general comment concerning this configuration object.
"version": String yes The version key, fixed to “VoConHigh 5.0”.
"label": String no Label describing the content / version of the file.
"asr_paths": { IAsrPathsConfig } no The ASR paths configuration options.
"dynamic_content_consumer": [ { IDynamicContentConsumerConfig } ] yes The dynamic content consumer configuration options.
"recognizer": [ { IRecognizerConfig } ] yes The recognizer’s ASR paths configuration options.
"asr_manager": [ { IAsrManagerConfig } ] no The Asr Manager configuration options.
"application": [ { IApplicationConfig } ] yes The application configurations.
"input": [ { IBaseInputConfig } ] yes The input configurations.
"nlu": [ { IBaseNluConfig } ] no The nlu configurations.
"search_filter": [ { ISearchFilterConfig } ] no Configures search filters of the search spaces.
"additional_data": [ { ISem3AdditionalDataConfig } ] no Configures the additional data of the sem3 app
"filter": [ { ISem3FilterConfig } ] no Configures sem3 filters of the sem3 data.
"configuration": [ { ISem3AdditionalDataConfigurationConfig } ] no Configures the configuration of the sem3 additional data
"lexicon": [ { ILexiconConfig } ] no The lexicon configuration options.

Details:

"comment":
A general comment concerning this configuration object.
"version":
The version key, fixed to “VoConHigh 5.0”.
"label":
Label describing the content / version of the file.
"asr_paths":

The ASR paths configuration options.

It configures the paths to the data that will be used in Asr. See also: IAsrPathsConfig

"dynamic_content_consumer":

The dynamic content consumer configuration options.

Dynamic Content Consumers (DCCs) are used to process lists of dynamic data. For example, a phone book or music collection would be such a list. Depending on the type of dynamic content consumer, they do different kinds of processing. See also: IDynamicContentConsumerConfig

"recognizer":

The recognizer’s ASR paths configuration options.

The recognizer configuration file configures the parameters for each recognizer. See also: IRecognizerConfig

"asr_manager":

The Asr Manager configuration options.

The asr5 manager configuration file configures the parameters for asr5 manager. See also: IAsrManagerConfig

"application":

The application configurations.

The application related configuration. See also: IApplicationConfig

"input":

The input configurations.

The input related configuration. See also: IBaseInputConfig

"nlu":

The nlu configurations.

The nlu related configuration. See also: IBaseNluConfig

"search_filter":

Configures search filters of the search spaces.

The search filter related configuration. See also: ISearchFilterConfig

"additional_data":

Configures the additional data of the sem3 app

The sem3 app additional data related configuration. See also: ISem3AdditionalDataConfig

"filter":

Configures sem3 filters of the sem3 data.

The sem3 filter related configuration. See also: ISem3FilterConfig

"configuration":

Configures the configuration of the sem3 additional data

The sem3 app additional data configuration related configuration. See also: ISem3AdditionalDataConfigurationConfig

"lexicon":

The lexicon configuration options.

The lexicon specifies how phonemes are retrieved. It groups one or more transcription providers for transcription lookup. See also: ILexiconConfig

IUserJsonConfig - Defines a verbatim block of json that is used by VoCon High as is.

Defines a verbatim block of json that is used by VoCon High as is.

This is for example used to pass json configuration block on to VoCon Hybrid that need to configured by users of Vocon High. The Connection Info object in ASR is an example of this.

This object lists not specific attributes because any valid json object can be used here, so the number, types and names of attributes are not limited.

IAsrPathsConfig - Configures all the directories where vocon high 5 stores and retrieves data files.

Configures all the directories where vocon high 5 stores and retrieves data files.

All paths are relative to the configuration root directory. The initialization of the AsrPathConfig object will fail if:

* Unknown key will be added to the JSON file.

* The type of the key in this file will be different to the defined type.

* The mandatory key is missing.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"acmod":
[ String ]
no
List of directories where the acoustic models are located.
This property supports vh_callback.
"asr":
[ String ]
yes
List of directories where the asr configuration data file is located.
This property supports vh_callback.
"liquid":
[ String ]
yes
List of directories where the liquid configuration data file is located.
This property supports vh_callback.
"search":
[ String ]
no
List of directories where the context files are stored.
This property supports vh_callback.
"search_cache":
[ String ]
no
Directory where the cached context files are stored
This property supports vh_callback.
"clc":
[ String ]
no
List of directories where the clc files are stored.
This property supports vh_callback.
"dictionary":
[ String ]
no
List of directories where the dictionaries are stored.
This property supports vh_callback.
"sem3":
[ String ]
no
List of directories where the sem3 context files are stored.
This property supports vh_callback.
"lex_cache":
[ String ]
no
Directory where the archived lexcache files are stored.
This property supports vh_callback.
"clc_cache":
[ String ]
no
Directory where the archived clc context files are stored
This property supports vh_callback.
"clc_ruleset":
[ String ]
no
Directory where clc ruleset files are stored
This property supports vh_callback.
"language_model":
[ String ]
no
List of directories where the language model buffer are stored.
This property supports vh_callback.
"audio_based_classifier_model":
[ String ]
no
List of directories where the audio-based classifer model are stored.
This property supports vh_callback.

Details:

"acmod":

List of directories where the acoustic models are located.

This is the list of possible directories where the acoustic models are stored.

The key is mandatory if you have one or more applications that do local recognition.

Note: Because of a current limitation, this directory should only contain acoustic models and no other type of vocon high data files.

"asr":

List of directories where the asr configuration data file is located.

This is the list of possible directories where the asr data configuration file is stored. The name of the data file must be: vocon3200_asr.dat

The key is mandatory

"liquid":

List of directories where the liquid configuration data file is located.

This is the list of possible directories where the liquid data configuration file is stored.

The key is mandatory

"search":

List of directories where the context files are stored.

The key is mandatory if you have one or more applications that do local recognition.

"search_cache":

Directory where the cached context files are stored

defines the folder where the dynamically created context files will be saved. This folder will be automatically created if it doesn’t exist. This key is optional. If the key is not present the contexts will need to be recreated when the system starts up. The key is mandatory if you want to enable the context persistence feature.

"clc":

List of directories where the clc files are stored.

The key is mandatory if you have one or more lexicons that contain a clc.

"dictionary":

List of directories where the dictionaries are stored.

Dictionaries must be in binary format, text dictionar are not supported.

The key is mandatory if you have one or more lexicons that contain an exception dictionary.

"sem3":

List of directories where the sem3 context files are stored.

The key is mandatory if you have a application with a sem3 engine.

"lex_cache":

Directory where the archived lexcache files are stored.

This key is required if you configured a persistent lexcache (ILexCacheConfig) in the lexicon.

"clc_cache":

Directory where the archived clc context files are stored

Optional key containing a filename with an already existing CLC cache archive. When the file does not exist or the filename is an empty string an empty CLC cache is created. When the lexicon is destroyed the CLC cache is archived to the file any existing file is overwritten. When an empty string was given the CLC cache is not archived.

"clc_ruleset":

Directory where clc ruleset files are stored

If user configures one or more rulesets then this location should be specified in the configuration file.

"language_model":

List of directories where the language model buffer are stored.

The key is mandatory if you have a search with a language model configured.

"audio_based_classifier_model":

List of directories where the audio-based classifer model are stored.

The audio-based classifier model is acmod dependent

IAcModConfig - The configuration of ACMOD.

The configuration of ACMOD.

This configuration class defines ACMOD and its parameters.

Additional constraint: The following properties are mutually exclusively required: file_name, file_path

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"name": String no The name of the ACMOD configuration.
"file_name":
String
see “Additional constraint”
The ACMOD file name.
This property supports vh_callback.
"file_path":
String
see “Additional constraint”
The acmod file path.
This property supports vh_callback.

Details:

"name":

The name of the ACMOD configuration.

It is important to note that the keys filename and file_path are mutually exclusive. The user should only specify one of them. If both are specified, the priority will go to the file_path.

"file_name":

The ACMOD file name.

It will be loaded from the acmod path location specified in the asr5_paths config .

"file_path":

The acmod file path.

This is the absolute file path (including the file name) of the acoustic model. The acmod directories in the asr5_path configuration are ignored in this case.

IAudioBasedClassifierConfig - The configuration of audio-based classifer model.

The configuration of audio-based classifer model.

This configuration class defines the model for the audio-based classifier

Additional constraint: The following properties are mutually exclusively required: file_name, file_path

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"file_name":
String
see “Additional constraint”
The audio-based classifier model file name.
This property supports vh_callback.
"file_path":
String
see “Additional constraint”
The audio-based classifier model file path.
This property supports vh_callback.

Details:

"file_name":

The audio-based classifier model file name.

It will be loaded from the acmod path location specified in the asr5_paths config .

"file_path":

The audio-based classifier model file path.

This is the absolute file path (including the file name) of the audio-based classifier model. The acmod directories in the asr5_path configuration are ignored in this case.

The configuration of Language.

This configuration class defines ACMODs and parameters that can be used to configure Language.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation

Details:

"name":

The name of the Language.

The name of the Language configuration.

"acmod":

The ACMOD configuration.

The set of ACMOD related configurations. See also: IAcModConfig

"audio_based_classifier_model":

The audio-based classifier configuration.

The set of audio-based classifier related configurations. See also: IAudioBasedClassifierConfig

"vocon_parameters":
VoCon parameters related to ACMOD

The name of the Audio Input.

IAsrEngineConfig - The configuration of ASR Engine.

The configuration of ASR Engine.

IConsolidatedUpdateConfig - This specifies a consolidated update config

This specifies a consolidated update config

A consolidated update is a piece of binary data which is the combination of a set of over-the-air updates. It it is this type of buffer which will be kept on the runtime platform. The over-the-air updates themselves need not be kept on the platform.

It is important to note that the keys file_name and file_path are mutually exclusive. The user should only specify one of them. If both are specified, the priority will go to the file_path.

Additional constraint: The following properties are mutually exclusively required: file_name, file_path

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"file_name":
String
see “Additional constraint”
This property supports vh_callback.
"file_path":
String
see “Additional constraint”
The consolidated update absolute path (including the filename). It is a required field in case the filename key is not provided
This property supports vh_callback.

Details:

"file_name":
[brief] The consolidated update file name. It is a required field in case the file_path key is not provided. The file should be located under context_update asr5_path in this case. [/brief]
"file_path":
The consolidated update absolute path (including the filename). It is a required field in case the filename key is not provided

IEntryLinkConfig - Entry info for linking in dynamic content consumers context

Super type: ILinkConfig

Entry info for linking in dynamic content consumers context

Gives the “clc_category” to use for the lookup and the “name” of the referenced field

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"name": String yes The name of the referenced field
"clc_category": String yes The Clc category to use for the lookup
"add_tag": String, one of "true" and "false" no, default value is “false” DEPRECATED (Please use tag_name instead)!!, add a tag around the content of the link
"tag_name": String no tag name to add around the content of the link

Details:

"name":
The name of the referenced field
"clc_category":
The Clc category to use for the lookup
"add_tag":

DEPRECATED (Please use tag_name instead)!!, add a tag around the content of the link

Set this key to true if you want to add tags around the content of the link. These tags appear in the recognition result in the same way as other tags/slots (e.g. !tag(..) statement in bnf grammar)

The name of the tag is the same as the name value without the optional _Ortho suffix. When you get the data from a COP file this is the name of the column that this link refers to.

"tag_name":

tag name to add around the content of the link

Set this key if you want a specific tag to be added around the content of the link. These tags appear in the recognition result in the same way as other tags/slots (e.g. !tag(..) statement in bnf grammar)

IClcBaseDictionaryConfig - A dictionary to be used in CLC

Sub types:
  • "type": "static", see IClcStaticDictionaryConfig
  • "type": "dynamic", see IClcDynamicDictionaryConfig

A dictionary to be used in CLC

There are two ways to specify a transcription for a word in an user dictionary and load it to CLC:

  • by specifying a phonetic transcription in the phonetic alphabet.
  • by specifying an orthographic transcription (i.e., written text) for which you expect that the grapheme-to-phoneme module will generate a phonetic transcription that “sounds like” the word. This type of transcription cannot be used on the VoCon recognizer directly. It only works when used on a user dictionary added to the CLC component.
Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"type": String, one of "static", "dynamic" yes Select the sub-type.
inline keys from sub-type { IClcStaticDictionaryConfig } depends Required if and only if "type": "static".
inline keys from sub-type { IClcDynamicDictionaryConfig } depends Required if and only if "type": "dynamic".

Details:

IClcDictionaryConfig - Represent a CLC dictionary.

Represent a CLC dictionary.

A CLC dictionary is a binary file (.dcb) that contains mapping from orthographic entries to phonetic transcriptions and optionally a lookup strategy.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"filename": String yes Dictionary’s file name
"lookup_strategy": " LookupStrategy " no The lookup strategy, defaults to LH_CLC_DCTLOOKUP_USE_LID

Details:

"filename":
Dictionary’s file name
"lookup_strategy":

The lookup strategy, defaults to LH_CLC_DCTLOOKUP_USE_LID

" LookupStrategy ": The lookup strategy used by the CLC instance for this dictionary

  • "LH_CLC_DCTLOOKUP_USE_LID": Using this strategy, the dictionary is consulted based on the language identification module.”
  • "LH_CLC_DCTLOOKUP_IGNORE_LID": Using this strategy, the dictionary is always consulted, no matter what the input language of the system is.

IClcConfig - The CLC configuration

The CLC configuration

It consists of a binary CLC buffer file (.dat), VoCon parameters, a list of CLC dictionaries, an exception dictionary, and a list of rule sets.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"filename": String yes The file name of binary CLC buffer (.dat)
"vocon_parameters": { IVPClcConfig } no VoCon parameters related to CLC
"clc_cache": String no CLC cache filename
"dictionary": [ { IClcDictionaryConfig } ] no !!DEPRECATED (Please use “dict” section instead)-the CLC (user) dictionaries
"ruleset": [ String ] no The list of rule sets, given by rule set file names
"dict": [ { IClcBaseDictionaryConfig } ] no A list of CLC user dictionaries.

Details:

"filename":
The file name of binary CLC buffer (.dat)
"vocon_parameters":
VoCon parameters related to CLC
"clc_cache":

CLC cache filename

Structured transcriptions can be cached via the so called CLC cache.

Optional key containing a filename with an already existing CLC cache archive. When the file does not exist or the filename is an empty string an empty CLC cache is created. When the lexicon is destroyed the CLC cache is archived to the file any existing file is overwritten. When an empty string was given the CLC cache is not archived.

"dictionary":
!!DEPRECATED (Please use “dict” section instead)-the CLC (user) dictionaries
"ruleset":
The list of rule sets, given by rule set file names
"dict":

A list of CLC user dictionaries.

The list of CLC user dictionaries (dynamic and static), in order of lookup. Only binary dictionaries are supported.

ILexiconConfig - The lexicon configuration

The lexicon configuration

Note: currently user word dictionary in Lexicon does not support.

The lexicon groups a few elements for transcription lookup. One can attach a user word dictionary, and Common Linguistic Component (CLC) modules(also called Grapheme To Phoneme (G2P) modules), to the lexicon.

A user word dictionary is configured with the key user_word_dictionary.

A CLC can be set by using the key clc.

All keys are optional, but there should be at least one key. A lexicon with only dictionaries or only a CLC is a valid lexicon.

When no transcription is found at runtime, an error will be logged and the entry will not be available for recognition. This can happen if a word does not appear in any dictionary and no CLC is used. It will also happen on a lexicon without a dictionary or CLC.

The lexicon implements a strict order of transcription lookup. The lexicon can return multiple transcriptions for the same word as long as these transcriptions come from the same source. The lexicon will never combine transcriptions from different sources (e.g. multiple dictionaries).

The lookup order is as follows:

The user word dictionary is searched.

If no transcriptions are found, then the CLC module is consulted and will generate transcription(s).

By this order, it is possible to overrule the CLC transcriptions by the user word dictionary.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"name": String no The name of the lexicon
"output_languages": { IOutputLanguagesConfig } no The output languages
"clc": { IClcConfig } no The clc configuration
"lex_cache": { ILexCacheConfig } no The lexCache configuration
"text_normalizer": { ITextNormalizerConfig } no Text normalizer, performing normalization before phonetic transcription

Details:

"name":

The name of the lexicon

The name of the lexicon. This name is required if (1) you create a lexicon via the API call: IRecognizer::createLexicon or if (2) you refer to this lexicon in a dynamic content consumer configuration

"output_languages":

The output languages

It is possible to set the output languages. The output languages are either specified by the language strings (ex. “string”: [“ENU”, “FRF”, …]), or by specifying an acoustic model, so that the generated phonetics are compatible with the acoustic model. See IOutputLanguagesConfig for more details.

Note: It is important to note that the output_languages block is only used through the ILexicon api. When the lexicon is used in a dynamic content consumer, the output_languages block will be ignored and the output language will be set to match the acoustic model used in that IDynamicContentConsumerConfig.

"clc":

The clc configuration

This key hooks a CLC on the lexicon.

"lex_cache":

The lexCache configuration

A lexicon cache (ILexCacheConfig) can optionally be used to cache the previously used transcriptions. This cache can result in a speed up of the transcription lookup in cases where the same set of words are transcribed several times (e.g. address book compilation).

"text_normalizer":

Text normalizer, performing normalization before phonetic transcription

The text normalizer performs a normalization of the original orthographies before their phonetic transcription.

ILexCacheConfig - The LexCache configuration

The LexCache configuration

A lexicon cache can optionally be used to cache the G2P transcriptions in a lexicon lookup (see ILexiconConfig). This cache can result in a speed up of the transcription lookup in cases where the same set of words are transcribed several times (e.g. address book compilation).

See also: ILexiconConfig

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"persist": String, one of "true" and "false" no, default value is “false” persist the cache
"cache_word_size": int no Size of the lexicon cache

Details:

"persist":

persist the cache

By default the cache is not persistent, i.e. this key value is false.

Set this key to true if you want to save the lexcache to file when the lexicon is no longer used. Upon startup the cache will be re-initialized from this file.

If you set this key to true then you need to specify the key lexcache in the IAsrPathsConfig.

"cache_word_size":

Size of the lexicon cache

Size of the lexicon cache (in number of words). -1 represent no size limitation. otherwise the value range is greater than zero and less than 65536.

IOutputLanguagesConfig - Configures the output language from a lexicon

Configures the output language from a lexicon

It is possible to set the output languages. The output languages are either specified by the language strings (ex. “string”: [“ENU”, “FRF”, …]), or by specifying an acoustic model, so that the phonetics that are generated are compatible with the acoustic model.

Is used in ILexiconConfig

Additional constraint: The following properties are mutually exclusively required: acmod, string

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"acmod": String see “Additional constraint” The acoustic model
"string":
[ String ]
see “Additional constraint”
The list of output languages in 3 letter code format
This property supports vh_callback.

Details:

"acmod":

The acoustic model

The lexicon configured with ILexiconConfig generates phonemes that correspond to the language(s) supported by the given acoustic model.

This key is mutual exclusive with the string key.

"string":

The list of output languages in 3 letter code format

The lexicon configured with ILexiconConfig generates phonemes that correspond to the language(s) specified in the string property. The languages must be specified with their 3 letter language codes. (e.g. [TT]ENU[/TT], [TT]FRF[/TT], …)

This key is mutually exclusive with the acmod key.

ITextNormalizerConfig -

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"replace_with_whitespace":
[ String ]
no
List of strings that are replaced with a whitespace.
This property supports vh_callback.

Details:

"replace_with_whitespace":

List of strings that are replaced with a whitespace.

The strings given in this list are removed from the original orthographies and replaced with a space.

IERPAudioFormatConfig - The audio format configuration.

The audio format configuration.

This configuration can be referenced with ("uses") from other parts of the configuration using the name key. The name of audio format has to be unique.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"name": String no The name of the audio format.
"sample_rate": int yes The sampling rate in Hz.
"samples_per_channel": int yes The number of units per channel.
"channel_count": int yes The number of channels.
"encoding": " Encoding " no, default value is ENCODING_PCM_16BIT The encoding type.
"container": " Container " no, default value is CONTAINER_NONE The container type.

Details:

"name":

The name of the audio format.

This key is used for referencing this audio format from other parts of the configuration.

"sample_rate":
The sampling rate in Hz.
"samples_per_channel":

The number of units per channel.

This key defines the samples per channel for plain PCM data (ENCODING_PCM_16BIT) without a container (CONTAINER_NONE). In all other cases it defines bytes per channel. It has to be an even value not an odd value.

"channel_count":
The number of channels.
"encoding":

The encoding type.

VoconHigh supports the following encoding: - ENCODING_PCM_16BIT (default) - ENCODING_OPUS - ENCODING_USER

" Encoding ":

  • "ENCODING_USER": user specific encoding type, unknown by the system
  • "ENCODING_PCM_16BIT": Signed 16Bit PCM raw data
  • "ENCODING_OPUS": OPUS encoding
"container":

The container type.

VoconHigh supports the following containers: - CONTAINER_NONE (default) - CONTAINER_OGG

VoconHigh does not support CONTAINER_USER

" Container ":

  • "CONTAINER_NONE": No container used/desired
  • "CONTAINER_OGG": OGG container

  • “container”: “CONTAINER_OGG”
  • “encoding”: “ENCODING_OPUS”

  • “samples_per_channel”: 512
  • “buffer_count”: 1

IStructuredContentConfig - Declaration of the structured content configuration

Declaration of the structured content configuration

This configuration defines the structure of the data sent to the server when data is uploaded.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation

"id": String yes Link to the id value in the input.

Details:

"category":

The data category

Used for NVC data upload mode only.

"id":

Link to the id value in the input.

This key specifies which input column should be used as ID. The ID values identify each content item uploaded to the server and must therefore be unique.

"content":

Specifies the content that is sent to the server.

This configuration declares which key/value pairs are sent to the server. Each key contains a link to the input content that is used as its value.

ISpeechEventConfig - The configuration of speech event.

The configuration of speech event.

This configuration class defines the parameters that can be used to configure speech event.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"show_nth_event":
int
no, default value is 1
The interval number of events to be shown
This property supports vh_callback.

Details:

"show_nth_event":

The interval number of events to be shown

It indicates the interval number of speech events which will be sent to the dialog.

  • If the value is N (>=1), then every Nth speech events should be sent to the dialog.
  • In case the transition between the events (RECOGNIZER_SPEECH_DETECTED/RECOGNIZER_SILENCE_DETECTED) will happen inside of the intervals, the event should be always sent to the dialog and the interval count should be restart from the transition time.
  • The default value is 1, which means every speech event should be sent to the dialog.
  • if the value is 0, then the event should be only sent to dialog when transition happen.

IWeightConfig - Configuration which includes application inputs specific information

Configuration which includes application inputs specific information

"name": String yes The name of the entity to set a weight for
"weight": int yes The weight value to set, should be in range 0 to 10000.

Details:

"name":
The name of the entity to set a weight for
"weight":
The weight value to set, should be in range 0 to 10000.

IVPSearchConfig - Vocon Parameters for search space configuration

Vocon Parameters for search space configuration

The groups of parameters are: - SEARCH PARAMETERS

Note that, regarding the search space parameters, the preferred way to set search space parameters is setting them when building the search spaces. However, the set parameter value at this level will be effective for this search space, overriding the values specified on a toplevel configuration (i.e. application).

The following parameters can be set statically or dynamically, via callback. For the last, please refere to the VoConHigh guide.

Finally, please refer to the VoCon Hybrid documentation for last information updates on the parameters.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_STREAM_RESULT_MODE": int no The mode in which intermediate results are displayed during recognition.
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_ACCURACY": int no  
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_MAXNBEST": int no Maximum number of hypotheses returned in a result.
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TSILENCE": int no Minimum amount of trailing silence, in milliseconds.
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_IG_LOWCONF": int no  
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_IG_HIGHCONF": int no  
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_INITBEAMWIDTH": int no Init beam width
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TANYSPEECH": String no Allows the recognizer to stop the recognition process during the trailing AnySpeech state.
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_NBESTRESULT_SETHIDDENKEYS": String no When enabled additional information is included on the ASR result that can be used for the FM use case.
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_ONDEMANDLOADING": int no Context on-demand loading.
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_ONDEMANDLOADING_IDMAP": int no Context on-demand loading id map.
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_LMFACTOR": int no FSTDP language-model factor.
"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_WORDSCORE_MODE": int no The mode in which scores are assigned to word transitions.

Details:

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_STREAM_RESULT_MODE":

The mode in which intermediate results are displayed during recognition.

Possible values are: LH_SEARCH_STREAM_RESULT_DISABLED = 0, LH_SEARCH_STREAM_RESULT_INTERMEDIATE = 1 or LH_SEARCH_STREAM_RESULT_STRIPPED_INTERMEDIATE = 2.

When set to LH_SEARCH_STREAM_RESULT_INTERMEDIATE intermediate outputs are generated whenever new stable words are found. The output will grow and the final output will contain the entire utterance. When set to LH_SEARCH_STREAM_RESULT_STRIPPED_INTERMEDIATE the part that has been flagged as stable is removed from all internal structures. All subsequent intermediate and final result outputs will no longer contain the respective part of the utterance.

Default: LH_SEARCH_STREAM_RESULT_DISABLED: no intermediate result output is created

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_ACCURACY":

[brief] Trade-off between CPU-load, memory requirements and the obtained accuracy of the search. [/brief]

With a lower value, less CPU-time and memory are needed, but the accuracy also degrades. With a higher value, more CPU-time and memory are needed, but the performance increases.

**Default**: 10000 **Range**: 100 -> 50000

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_MAXNBEST":

Maximum number of hypotheses returned in a result.

**Default**: 3 **Range**: 1 -> 1000

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TSILENCE":

Minimum amount of trailing silence, in milliseconds.

Minimum amount of trailing silence, in milliseconds, as observed by the search engine, before the end of an utterance is detected. This parameter affects low-level behavior of the algorithm and it should be used with care. Quite often, the optimal value of LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TSILENCE is twice as high as the value of LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TSILENCE_FX. The optimal value is context-dependent however. If you have a sufficient amount of representative speech data, and the response time of the engine is too long, you may want to experiment with different values.

**Default**: 0 ms (disabled) **Range**: 0 ms, 100 ms -> 10000 ms

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_IG_LOWCONF":

[brief] Maximum amount of confidence level that indicates that a spoken utterance is out of grammar. [/brief]

If confidence level is equal or below this parameter value, it means that the spoken utterance is out of grammar. If confidence level is above value of this parameter, the spoken utterance can be probably in grammar.

**Default**: 5000 **Range**: 0 -> 10000

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_IG_HIGHCONF":

[brief] Minimum amount of confidence level that indicates that a spoken utterance is in grammar. [/brief]

If confidence level is equal or above this parameter value, it means that the spoken utterance is in grammar (even though it is the same as LH_SEARCH_PARAM_IG_LOWCONF value). If confidence level is below this parameter value, the spoken utterance can be probably in grammar or out of grammar.

**Default**: 5000 **Range**: 0 -> 10000

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_INITBEAMWIDTH":

Init beam width

This parameter affects low-level behavior of the algorithm. It is solely intended for tuning tools. DO not touch, unless you know what you are doing. Can be used on all DP types.

**Default**: 2500 **range**: 0 -> 10000

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TANYSPEECH":

Allows the recognizer to stop the recognition process during the trailing AnySpeech state.

This parameter changes the behavior of the LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TSILENCE parameter. Normally, enabling LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TSILENCE makes the recognizer stop when the best hypothesis remains in trailing silence for at least the specified amount of time. When also this parameter LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TANYSPEECH is set to LH_TRUE, it makes the recognizer stop when the best hypothesis remains in trailing silence or in the trailing AnySpeech state for at least the amount of time specified in LH_SEARCH_PARAM_TSILENCE. That is, when this parameter is enabled, the “end of utterance” detection will not make a distinction between silence or AnySpeech.

Enabling this parameter only has an effect if the recognition grammar contains a trailing AnySpeech state (<…>) in at least one of its paths. Enabling this parameter will not automatically add such an AnySpeech state to the grammar.

**Default**: LH_FALSE **Range**: LH_TRUE, LH_FALSE

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_NBESTRESULT_SETHIDDENKEYS":

When enabled additional information is included on the ASR result that can be used for the FM use case.

**Default**: LH_FALSE **Range**: LH_TRUE, LH_FALSE

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_ONDEMANDLOADING":

Context on-demand loading.

**Default**: LH_FALSE **Range**: LH_TRUE, LH_FALSE

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_ONDEMANDLOADING_IDMAP":

Context on-demand loading id map.

Read-only parameter.

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_LMFACTOR":

FSTDP language-model factor.

This parameter affects the balance between acoustic model and language model. It is solely intended for tuning tools. Do not touch, unless you know what you are doing.

"LH_SEARCH_PARAM_WORDSCORE_MODE":

The mode in which scores are assigned to word transitions.

The wordscore-mode is a read-only parameter set by the context creation tool.

**Default**: LH_FSTCTX_WORDSCORE_MODE_UNIFORM **Range**: LH_FSTCTX_WORDSCORE_MODE_UNIFORM, LH_FSTCTX_WORDSCORE_MODE_SLM

IVPLanguageConfig - Vocon Parameters for language configuration

Finally, please refer to the VoCon 5 documentation for last information updates on the parameters.

IVPEngineConfig - Vocon Parameters for ASR Engine configuration

Vocon Parameters for ASR Engine configuration

The groups of parameters are: - ENGINE PARAMETERS

The following parameters can be set statically or dynamically, via callback. For the last, please refere to the VoConHigh guide.

Finally, please refer to the VoCon 5 documentation for last information updates on the parameters.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"LH_ENGINE_PARAM_SPEECHDETECTOR_ABSOLUTE_THRESHOLD": int no Absolute speech energy threshold for speech detector.
"LH_ENGINE_PARAM_SPEECHDETECTOR_SENSITIVITY": int no Sensitivity of the speech detector system.
"LH_ENGINE_PARAM_AUDIOBUFFERSIZE_LEVEL1": int no Size of the level 1 audio buffer in milli-seconds.
"LH_ENGINE_PARAM_AUDIOBUFFERSIZE_LEVEL2": int no Size of the level 2 audio buffer in milli-seconds.

Details:

"LH_ENGINE_PARAM_SPEECHDETECTOR_ABSOLUTE_THRESHOLD":

Absolute speech energy threshold for speech detector.

The energy of the input signal must come above this threshold to trigger the speech detector.

**Default**: -6000 (-60dB) **Range**: -7200 (-72 dB) -> 1800 (18 dB)

"LH_ENGINE_PARAM_SPEECHDETECTOR_SENSITIVITY":

Sensitivity of the speech detector system.

The higher this value, the easier begin of speech will be detected.

**Default**: 50 **Range**: 0 -> 100

"LH_ENGINE_PARAM_AUDIOBUFFERSIZE_LEVEL1":

Size of the level 1 audio buffer in milli-seconds.

The memory required for this buffer is approximately 10 kBytes per second of audio.

**Default**: 5000 **Range**: > 0

"LH_ENGINE_PARAM_AUDIOBUFFERSIZE_LEVEL2":

Size of the level 2 audio buffer in milli-seconds.

The memory required for this buffer is approximately 50 kBytes per second of audio and per acoustic model set on the engine.

**Default**: 2000 **Range**: > 0

IVPAudioInputConfig - Vocon Parameters for Audio Input configuration

Vocon Parameters for Audio Input configuration

The groups of parameters are: - AUDIOINPUT PARAMETERS

The following parameters can be set statically or dynamically, via callback. For the last, please refere to the VoConHigh guide.

Finally, please refer to the VoCon 5 documentation for last information updates on the parameters.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"LH_AUDIOINPUT_PARAM_ENVIRONMENT_RESET": String no This parameter controls the reset behavior of all engine environment adaptations.

Details:

"LH_AUDIOINPUT_PARAM_ENVIRONMENT_RESET":

This parameter controls the reset behavior of all engine environment adaptations.

If set to LH_FALSE (the default), all engine environment adaptations are carried over from the previous audio inputs. It implies that the results may be influenced by previous audio. This is the preferred setting if the previous audio is known to come from the same environment.

If set to LH_TRUE, all engine environment adaptations are reset to their default initial value at the start of the audio. It implies that the results are not influenced by the previous audio. This is the preferred setting if it is unsure whether the previous audio came from the same environment.

**Range**: LH_TRUE or LH_FALSE **Default**: LH_FALSE

IVPClcConfig - Vocon Parameters for CLC configuration

Vocon Parameters for CLC configuration

The groups of parameters are: - CLC PARAMETERS

The following parameters can be set statically or dynamically, via callback. For the last, please refere to the VoConHigh guide.

Finally, please refer to the VoCon Hybrid documentation for last information updates on the parameters.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"LH_CLC_PARAM_NUMBER_OUTPUT_TRANSCRIPTIONS": int no Maximum number of transcriptions returned
"LH_CLC_PARAM_NO_RICH_TRANSCRIPTION": String no Generate simple transcriptions
"LH_CLC_PARAM_CLM_VARIANTS": String no CLM Variants
"LH_CLC_PARAM_NUMBER_PARTIAL_ORTH_VARIANTS": int no Parameter to limit the number of generated partial orthographic variants
"LH_CLC_PARAM_GENERATE_WORD_MARKERS": String no Generate word markers
"LH_CLC_PARAM_ML_EXTRA_MAINLANG_TRANSCRIPTIONS": String no Parameter to generate extra transcription variants in the main language
"LH_CLC_PARAM_ML_NR_PROMOTED_MAIN_TRANS": int no Maximum number of transcriptions from the main language to promote
"LH_CLC_PARAM_ML_POS_PROMOTED_MAIN_TRANS": int no Position where promoted transcriptions from the main language will be inserted in a result
"LH_CLC_PARAM_IGNORE_SILENCES_FROM_DICTIONARY": String no Ignore silences in transcriptions from dictionary.
"LH_CLC_PARAM_DISABLE_MULTI_WORD_DICTIONARY_WITHOUT_ESC_SEQ_LOOKUP": String no Disables multi word without escape sequences dictionary lookup.
"LH_CLC_PARAM_CACHE_SIZE": int no Maximum cache size in bytes in memory.

Details:

"LH_CLC_PARAM_NUMBER_OUTPUT_TRANSCRIPTIONS":

Maximum number of transcriptions returned

Use this option if you want to specify the maximum number of transcriptions to get for each input terminal. If no value is specified it will be taken from the CLC binary data buffer

**Default**: the default value is taken from the buffer **Range**: 1 -> 65535

"LH_CLC_PARAM_NO_RICH_TRANSCRIPTION":

Generate simple transcriptions

Generate simple transcriptions without stress post-processing nor syllabification nor cross-word effects. These transcriptions can only be used for ASR not for TTS. Switching on this option increases the processing speed.

**Default**: 0 **Range**: 1, 0

"LH_CLC_PARAM_CLM_VARIANTS":

CLM Variants

In case that the CLC output is multilingual, set the parameter for activating the generation of extra phonetic variants in the primary language through cross-lingual phonetic mapping (CLM).

**Range**: 1, 0 **Default**: 0

"LH_CLC_PARAM_NUMBER_PARTIAL_ORTH_VARIANTS":

Parameter to limit the number of generated partial orthographic variants

**Range**: 1 - 65535 **Default**: 5

"LH_CLC_PARAM_GENERATE_WORD_MARKERS":

Generate word markers

In case the parameter is set CLC will emphasize the word boundary in the output, by putting either double underscores, or double hashes.

**Range**: 1 , 0 **Default**: 0

"LH_CLC_PARAM_ML_EXTRA_MAINLANG_TRANSCRIPTIONS":

Parameter to generate extra transcription variants in the main language

**Range**: 1, 0 **Default**: 1

"LH_CLC_PARAM_ML_NR_PROMOTED_MAIN_TRANS":

Maximum number of transcriptions from the main language to promote

**Range**: 0 - 65535. **Default**: 0.

"LH_CLC_PARAM_ML_POS_PROMOTED_MAIN_TRANS":

Position where promoted transcriptions from the main language will be inserted in a result

**Range**: 0 - 65535. **Default**: 0.

"LH_CLC_PARAM_IGNORE_SILENCES_FROM_DICTIONARY":

Ignore silences in transcriptions from dictionary.

**Range**: 1, 0 **Default**: 1

"LH_CLC_PARAM_DISABLE_MULTI_WORD_DICTIONARY_WITHOUT_ESC_SEQ_LOOKUP":

Disables multi word without escape sequences dictionary lookup.

**Range**: 1, 0 **Default**: 1

"LH_CLC_PARAM_CACHE_SIZE":

Maximum cache size in bytes in memory.

The parameter can be modified at any time but only has effect when activating a cache from scratch. Giving 0 means unlimited (maximum of unsigned 32 bits) cache size.

**Range**: 0 .. 2^32-1 **Default**: 1048576 (1 MB).

IVPDynamicFuzzyMatchContextConfig - Vocon Parameters for Dynamic Fuzzy Match Context configuration

Vocon Parameters for Dynamic Fuzzy Match Context configuration

The groups of parameters are: - FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL PARAMETERS

The following parameters can be set statically or dynamically, via callback. For the last, please refere to the VoConHigh guide.

Finally, please refer to the VoCon Hybrid documentation for last information updates on the parameters.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_EXPECTED_NBR_DOMAINS": int no This parameter specifies that the expected number of domains.
"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_CHECK_UNIQUENESS": String no This parameter controls the checking of uniqueness.
"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_IS_COMPRESSED": String no This parameter controls the compression of the context.
"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_ONDEMAND_LEVEL": int no This parameter specifies the on-demand loading level.
"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_ADVANCED_RESULT_SEPARATION": String no This parameter controls the use of context buffer

Details:

"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_EXPECTED_NBR_DOMAINS":

This parameter specifies that the expected number of domains.

**Range**: **Default**: 0

"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_CHECK_UNIQUENESS":

This parameter controls the checking of uniqueness.

**Range**: LH_TRUE or LH_FALSE **Default**: LH_FALSE

"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_IS_COMPRESSED":

This parameter controls the compression of the context.

This parameter controls the compression of the context. When this parameter is set as 0 the created fuzzy match context will not be compressed.

**Range**: LH_TRUE or LH_FALSE **Default**: LH_TRUE

"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_ONDEMAND_LEVEL":

This parameter specifies the on-demand loading level.

When set to 0, the context is fully loaded in RAM, the latency is minimal. When set to 1, the context is partly loaded in RAM, the latency is slightly higher. When set to 2, the context mainly stays on flash, the latency is the highest.

**Range**: 0 -> 2 **Default**: 1

"LH_FUZZYMATCHCTXCPL_PARAM_ADVANCED_RESULT_SEPARATION":

This parameter controls the use of context buffer

This attribute controls if a context buffer shall be created supporting a more consistent entry set separation and score computation. Advanced result separation functionality comes with a slightly increased context buffer size.

**Range**: LH_TRUE or LH_FALSE **Default**: LH_FALSE

IVPDynamicSlmContextConfig - Vocon Parameters for the dynamic Slm Context configuration

Vocon Parameters for the dynamic Slm Context configuration

The groups of parameters are: - Slm Trainer PARAMETERS

The following parameters can be set statically or dynamically, via callback. For the last, please refere to the VoConHigh guide.

Finally, please refer to the VoCon5 documentation for last information updates on the parameters.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"LH_SLMTRAINER_PARAM_NGRAM_ORDER": int no This parameter specifies the ngram order level.
"LH_SLMTRAINER_PARAM_SENTENCE_RESTART": String no This parameter sets allowing sentence restart.

Details:

"LH_SLMTRAINER_PARAM_NGRAM_ORDER":

This parameter specifies the ngram order level.

Sets the maximum n-gram order to be counted.

**Range**: 0 -> 5 **Default**: 2

"LH_SLMTRAINER_PARAM_SENTENCE_RESTART":

This parameter sets allowing sentence restart.

If set to 1, allow sentence restart. In this case, sentence start and sentence end will be trained into the same internal symbol. If set to 0, different internal symbols will be used for sentence start and sentence end

**Range**: LH_TRUE or LH_FALSE **Default**: LH_FALSE

IVPDynamicContentConsumerContextConfig - Vocon Parameters for the dynamic List Context configuration

Vocon Parameters for the dynamic List Context configuration

The groups of parameters are: - FSTCTX PARAMETERS

Finally, please refer to the VoCon5 documentation for last information updates on the parameters.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"LH_GRMCPL_PARAM_MAX_PARENTHESES_DEPTH": int no Set the maximum parentheses depth of the input.
"LH_GRMCPL_PARAM_WORDSCORE_SCALING": int no Sets the language model score scaling factor in percent.

Details:

"LH_GRMCPL_PARAM_MAX_PARENTHESES_DEPTH":

Set the maximum parentheses depth of the input.

The following BNF+ rule has a parenthesis depth of 10: <rule>: ((((((((((test)))))))))) If this value is exceeded during compilation then LH_E_LIMIT is return by lh_GrmCplRun.

**Default**: 50

"LH_GRMCPL_PARAM_WORDSCORE_SCALING":

Sets the language model score scaling factor in percent.

**Default**: 100 **Range**: 1 -> 100000

IDynamicContentConsumerConfig - A common configuration for all Dynamic Content Consumers

A common configuration for all Dynamic Content Consumers

Dynamic Content Consumers (DCCs) are used to process lists of dynamic data.

The priority of this dynamic content consumer

This property defines the priority of the dynamic content consumer thread. It can be LOW or NORMAL. If this optional property is not specified it will default to NORMAL.

"content":
The list of fields of this dynamic content consumer

"name":

The name of this dynamic content consumer

Progress Increment

This represent the amount of processed entries to inform the listener of through DCC_N_ENTRIES_PROCESSED.

"limit_g2p_logging_errors":

Limit G2P logging errors

This is the maximum number of G2P error log messages for this dynamic content consumer.

"thread_priority":

The priority of this dynamic content consumer

This property defines the priority of the dynamic content consumer thread. It can be LOW or NORMAL. If this optional property is not specified it will default to NORMAL.

"content":
The list of fields of this dynamic content consumer
"connection_info":
The connection info to use for the connection.
"cloud_services_name":
The name of the cloud services to use.
"structured_content":

Maps the format of COP file to the format the server expects.

This key is optional, if it is not available the data is sent to the server in the old format (only ‘contacts’ is supported in that case)

"command":
The command to upload data to the server.
"mode":

The data uploader mode.

The optional key which specifies the data uploader mode. Has two possible modes: * UPLOADER_MODE_NVC * UPLOADER_MODE_NCS

If not specified the default value is UPLOADER_MODE_NVC

"grammar_type":
The type of data to be uploaded to the server.
"data_chunk_size":

The data chunk size (i.e. the number of items per data block).

Mandatory : no Minimum Value: 1 Maximum Value: n/a Default Value: 50

"data_total_size":

The data total size (i.e. the number of items per data upload command).

Mandatory : no Minimum Value: 1 Maximum Value: n/a Default Value: 200

"timeout":

The command timeout (in milliseconds).

Mandatory : no Minimum Value: 1000 Maximum Value: n/a Default Value: 40000

"force_clear_all":

Force ClearAll when doing DataUpload.

Setting this option to false, will incrementally upload data on top of the existing data. The checksum from the last upload should be provided through the iterator.

IDynamicFuzzyMatchContextConfig - Context configuration for Fuzzy Match dynamic content consumers

Context configuration for Fuzzy Match dynamic content consumers

The contexts specify in what way data from the content list is combined. It does so by specifying contexts with references to the content fields.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"filename": String no the context’s file name
"name": String yes The name of the context
"acmod": String no The acoustic model (if needed) to use for generating this context.
"column": [ { IDynamicFuzzyMatchColumnConfig } ] yes This specifies the fuzzy match context column
"vocon_parameters": { IVPDynamicFuzzyMatchContextConfig } no VoCon parameters related to Fuzzy Match Context Compiler

Details:

"filename":

the context’s file name

Warning: This property is deprecated and will be replaced by “name”

"name":

The name of the context

The name of the context. This has to be unique inside this specific DCC. It is used as reference by the applications to access the context

"acmod":

The acoustic model (if needed) to use for generating this context.

The acoustic model is not needed if the fm context will only be used on a sem3context. I.e it will not be used as a context on the recognizer.

When you use the context on the recognizer then the acmod is mandatory!

"column":
This specifies the fuzzy match context column
"vocon_parameters":
VoCon parameters related to Fuzzy Match Context Compiler

IContentConfig - The description of the fields of the content for a dynamic content consumer

The description of the fields of the content for a dynamic content consumer

Conceptually the content of the dynamic content consumer is organized in a table. The “content” json array describes the columns of this table. For each colums it gives you the name and the type of data it can contain. E.g. (first_name, string) (last_name, string) (id, integer)

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"name": String yes The name of the column.
"type": " ContentConfigType " yes The type of this content field.

Details:

"name":
The name of the column.
"type":

The type of this content field.

" ContentConfigType ":

  • "string":
  • "integer":
  • "integer64":
  • "base64":
  • "string_list":
  • "string_list_list":

IBaseConnectionConfig -

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"expansion_point": String yes Specify the connection expansion point. It can be “merge” or the slot name
"search": { IBaseSearchConfig } yes A search space to recognize against.

Details:

"expansion_point":

Specify the connection expansion point. It can be “merge” or the slot name

“merge”: The search spaces are merged on the level of their respective start rules.

slot name: The guest search space is filled into the slot of host search space. For grammar-based slot contexts, list-based contexts and SLMs, the slot name is of the form slot:grammarname#rulename.

"search":

A search space to recognize against.

Various search spaces types are supported, including SLM, grammars and Fuzzy Match.

IWUWDynamicContentConsumerConfig - WUW Dynamic Content Consumer

Super type: IDynamicContentConsumerConfig

WUW Dynamic Content Consumer

WUW dynamic content consumers are used to compile lists of data into contexts usable by the on-board recognizer. Processing happens on the embedded system itself and no data is transferred to an off-board system.

Key Name Value Type Required? Documentation
"name":
String
yes
The name of this dynamic content consumer
This property is inherited from IDynamicContentConsumerConfig.
"progress_increment":
int
no, default value is 0
Progress Increment
This property is inherited from IDynamicContentConsumerConfig.
"limit_g2p_logging_errors":
int
no, default value is 5
Limit G2P logging errors
This property is inherited from IDynamicContentConsumerConfig.
"thread_priority":
String
no, default value is “NORMAL”
The priority of this dynamic content consumer
This property is inherited from IDynamicContentConsumerConfig.
"content":
[ { IContentConfig } ]
yes
The list of fields of this dynamic content consumer
This property is inherited from IDynamicContentConsumerConfig.
"lexicon": { ILexiconConfig } yes The lexicon to be used.
"search": { IDynamicContentConsumerContextConfig } yes The search spaces to be created
"id": String no The content name of the WUW ID. The ID content needs to be type “integer”, “integer64” or “base64”

Details:

"name":

The name of this dynamic content consumer

This is the name of this dynamic content consumer. This is how the content consumer is identified.

"progress_increment":

Progress Increment

This represent the amount of processed entries to inform the listener of through DCC_N_ENTRIES_PROCESSED.

"limit_g2p_logging_errors":

Limit G2P logging errors

This is the maximum number of G2P error log messages for this dynamic content consumer.

"thread_priority":

The priority of this dynamic content consumer

This property defines the priority of the dynamic content consumer thread. It can be LOW or NORMAL. If this optional property is not specified it will default to NORMAL.

"content":
The list of fields of this dynamic content consumer
"lexicon":
The lexicon to be used.
"search":
The search spaces to be created
"id":
The content name of the WUW ID. The ID content needs to be type “integer”, “integer64” or “base64”

IDynamicContentConsumerBagOfWordsConfig - Configure the bag of words DCC.

Super type: IDynamicContentConsumerConfig

Configure the bag of words DCC.

The bag of words dynamic content consumer implements the bag of words grammar modeling. The words of each added sentence are put into one BNF terminal disregarding any order.

"search": { IBagOfWordsDynamicContentConsumerContextConfig } yes Define the context to be generated by the data preparation.
